response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<SoapHeaderElement> responseHeaderElements = message.getSoapHeader().iterator();
while (responseHeaderElements.hasNext()) {
header = responseHeaderElements.next();
String responseCode = header.getAttributeValue(new QName(STATUS_QNAME));
break;
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the `getSoapHeader()` method to get the SOAP header of the message and then use the `iterator()` method to get an iterator for the header elements. In the loop, you can check if the `hasNext()` method returns true and then get the next element using the `next()` method. You can then use the `getAttributeValue()` method to get the value of the `STATUS_QNAME` attribute in the header element.
